column1: Clinical Management Consultants,"Mar 21, 2022","A fantastic career opportunity for Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department is now available with a prestigious healthcare system located in warm Texas!

The Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Services will join a medical center that is part of a growing and financially stable healthcare system nationwide with a mission to improve the health and well-being of each person it serves and a vision to demonstrate the highest-quality, best-value healthcare to all patients served.

The Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department will be responsible for the overall management and leadership in the delivery of comprehensive, high quality services provided in Invasive Cardiology Services on the 2 hospital campuses including the Cardiac Catheterization and Electrophysiology Laboratories.

The Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department will ensure that safe patient care is provided. The Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department will work with program development, service improvement and promotion, oversee the activities in the development of department staff. Reporting to the Vice President of Heart and Vascular Institute, the Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department will assist with the budget preparation and monitoring.

The ideal Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department will have previous management or supervisory experience with knowledge of cardiovascular and pulmonary anatomy, physiology and pathology and associated diagnostic techniques and medical interventions with new and inventive technologies. The Director of Cardiovascular Cath Lab Department will prepare annual budgets, develop spreadsheets, monitor and analyze financial information and implement operational changes to meet budget targets.

The hospital believes where you work matters and it is committed to being the best place to receive care, and also the best place to work. It rewards employees with generous compensation and benefits, individualized orientation, education and a supportive work environment. Join the prestigious team now!","https://www.glassdoor.com/job-listing/director-of-cardiovascular-cath-lab-department-clinical-management-consultants-JV_IC1140177_KO0,46_KE47,78.htm?jl=1007730827906",glassdoor

Ability to learn new methods and propose ideas to conducts projects or optimize assays.&lt
Ability to work both independently without supervision as well as be part of a team, demonstrating excellent communication and interpersonal skills, is required.&lt
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with demonstrated ability to manage several projects simultaneously is a must.&lt
Ability to effectively plan and organize work activities and prioritize task completion adhering to schedules and deadlines.&lt

column1: The Phlebotomist II performs phlebotomy and other specialized specimen collection procedures for patients both in in-patient and out-patient settings, ranging from routine to advanced functions. Responsibilities include the processing, organizing, labeling and transporting of specimens as well as the input and extraction of data with the Laboratory Information System. Provides for patient care while performing duties, independently handling patient care and technical issues as they arise within the scope of their job. As an experienced and fully competent Phlebotomist, serves as a role model and preceptor for staff. Also performs clerical tasks such as answering the phones and faxing lab reports as needed.&lt

Promotes a positive work environment and contributes to a dynamic, team focused work unit that actively helps one other to achieve optimal department results. Collaborates with all members of the patient care team by actively communicating and reporting pertinent patient care information and data in a comprehensive manner. (EF)&lt
Serves as a preceptor to less experienced and/or new staff and students by utilizing skills and knowledge to help train and educate others. (EF)&lt

Follows established procedure for collecting and processing biological specimens. Handles STAT samples expediently. Performs special collections/procedures as directed and according to competency and policies/procedures. (EF)&lt

Performs a variety of Laboratory Information System functions. Registers patients and/or order tests per the requisition as needed utilizing the patient information system. Files requisitions, reports and other pathology materials appropriately. (EF)&lt
Independently handles resolution of complex problems and issues and notifies management of issue and resolution. Serves as escalation support for less experienced staff. (EF)&lt
Sets pace for workload and troubleshoots workflow issues. Utilizes all available work time by assisting others and performing additional tasks. (EF)&lt
Performs and documents daily check off duties and restocks supplies in the work area as assigned. (EF)&lt

Performs interactive patient ID. Identifies patient and labels specimen correctly 100% of the time using two patient identifiers. Accurately processes, organizes, orders, labels and transports specimens for laboratory testing. (EF)&lt

Recognizes and initiates action to resolve requisition and specimen labeling discrepancies. Recognizes problems, investigates the cause, takes remedial action or escalates to leader and notifies management for follow-up. (EF)&lt
Maintains a safe environment within the Laboratory, following all policies and procedures for safety, hazardous materials, security and emergency preparedness. (EF)&lt
Adjusts work schedule to accommodate departmental/organizational needs. Appropriately utilizes the time recording system. (EF)&lt
Uses department resources/equipment/supplies properly and efficiently. (EF)&lt
Guides and mentors section employees and students to help build confidence in skills, knowledge and abilities. (EF)&lt
Participates in departmental projects activities, and seeks continuing education opportunities to expand learning beyond baseline competencies with a focus on continual development. (EF)&lt
This job description is not intended to be all inclusive

column3: Houston Methodist West Hospital is committed to leading medicine in West Houston, Katy and surrounding communities by delivering the Houston Methodist standard of exceptional safety, quality, personalized service and innovation.
